prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame representing car sales:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "CarID": ["C001", "C002", "C003", "C004", "C005", "C006", "C007", "C008"],
    "Brand": ["Toyota", "Honda", "Ford", "Toyota", "BMW", "Honda", "Ford", "BMW"],
    "Model": ["Camry", "Civic", "Focus", "Rav4", "X5", "Accord", "Mustang", "X3"],
    "Year": [2020, 2021, 2019, 2022, 2023, 2020, 2021, 2022],
    "PriceUSD": [25000, 22000, 18000, 30000, 60000, 24000, 45000, 55000],
    "Mileage": [30000, 20000, 45000, 15000, 5000, 35000, 10000, 8000]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) For each "Brand", calculate the average "PriceUSD" and the average "Mileage". 2) Create a new DataFrame showing these averages grouped by "Brand". 3) Print the resulting grouped DataFrame. Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, calculate average price and mileage per brand, and present this in a new grouped DataFrame.
